item.title: Using EasyGit as frontend for git
item.description:
The original thought was to divide git into 'plumbing' and 'porcelain' - as if working with a toilet. In my experience git does not handle as much waste as a toilet but the analogy might still work for others.

Porcelain is cute name for programs and program suites depending on core git, presenting a high level access to core git. Porcelains expose more of a SCM interface than the "plumbing".

—Git Wiki

item.title: A statically generated blog
item.description:
I have decided that it would be super cool and hip to switch from the wordpress blog that I hardly use to a static generated blog. I decided to use Nikola which seems simple enough to use for a blog and static pages.

The comfort I see in a static blog is that I can just push it via git to github and use that as hosting. Whenever I want to switch the hoster I just put the static files somewhere else. And it is just plain old fun to write content with vim in restructured text and turn it with magic into a blog :-). It will take some time and posts until the posts are more appealing to the eye

What I will be writing here will mostly consist of programming topics I work on - other things I do are so much less interesting that I do not even try to write about them.
